subject: Ethics
title: Who Decides What AI Should Do
description: A fast breakdown of Who Decides What AI Should Do for builders.

hook.text: A handful of companies control the most powerful AI on Earth. None of them were elected.

buildup.text: Google, OpenAI, Meta, and a few others set the rules for what AI can and can't do.

discovery.text: Their choices ripple everywhereâ€”what you see online, who gets hired, which loans get approved.

twist.text: When OpenAI's board fired its CEO in 2023, it revealed how fragile AI governance really is.

climax.text: Should tech CEOs, governments, or citizens decide AI's future? Right now, it's mostly shareholders.

punchline.text: The biggest decisions are made by the smallest rooms.

quiz.question: Who currently has the most control over powerful AI systems?
options: A small number of private technology companies
